snippet: With the 221-to-207 vote, the House dug in for another debt ceiling standoff.
abstract: House votes 221-to-207 to allow Treasury to continue to make payments to foreign and domestic federal creditors and Social Security recipients in event of stalemate over government's statutory borrowing limit, digging in for another debt ceiling standoff, which is looming in fall 2013.
lead_paragraph: With the 221-to-207 vote, the House dug in for another debt ceiling standoff.

headline.seo: House Votes to Give Creditors Priority if Debt Ceiling Is Breached
headline.main: House Vote on Debt Ceiling Gives Priority to Creditors
headline.print_headline: House Vote on Debt Ceiling Gives Priority to Creditors
